page.title: 09PONTELAND CRICKET CLUB
page.content: {Ponteland Cricket Club}was started in{1880}by{Mr J.Jameson}with a team of choir boys.The old ground used to be at Berwick Hill on a farm owned then and still now by the{Stevenson family.Fifty years after the start of the club Mr J.Jameson was awarded a barometer for being captain for fifty years.In{1968}the 1st team were Northumberland Division B champions.Ponteland Cricket Club is now situated at the back of the sports centre.The club has six teams in all.One of the first teams was the Diamond Inn Eleven.The club plays in the Northumberland A division.The matches are played on Saturdays and start at 1.30pm.Matches are also played during the week and on Sundays.Matches are sponsered by local firms,such as Callers and Snaith the butcher.
